summary: "The West Wing" is an American TV show about the fictional Democratic administration of President Josiah Bartlet. It aired on NBC from 1999 to 2006 and was set mainly in the West Wing of the White House. The series was created by Aaron Sorkin and starred actors like Rob Lowe, Allison Janney, and Martin Sheen. It won many awards, including two Peabody Awards and 26 Primetime Emmys, and is considered one of the greatest TV shows ever. Despite a drop in ratings after Sorkin left, it kept a loyal audience, especially among high-income viewers.
title: The West Wing
